text: <@U0260V4K1> / <@U0265G76F> : would love your comments/feedback on that draft copy - leaning toward option 1. any and all feedback/edits are MOST WELCOME.
but i want to at least have a rough content structure to design for
since we have a check-in this afternoon
Cool - I'll read through it first thing
reading
thanks bros
i'm messing up the document with lots of comments

in general, i think we need to be more conceptual with where we're going. This writing has been extremely helpful though in thinking through why I'm feeling that way. 

Think I'm realizing the hollowness of their words. "Content" is tossed about like it is the thing they sell. That's true to a point, though so is everybody else.

What makes trapit unique? How can we express that? 

From my perspective, it is about the intersection of humans and machines. So yes machines do content, but people do cupcakes, and CFOs from fortune 5 companies, and the impacts of global warming in Alaska, and rare 60s psych records

which is essentially the same premise that Squarespace has taken in their latest campaign: 

<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TtEq7xhTmUw>

attachments.title: Squarespace "meme&more" Super Bowl XLVIII  Commercial
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: Squarespace "meme&more" Super Bowl XLVIII  Commercial

text: yeah the words should absolutely change, but i think i want to at least use the loose structure to inform layouts
thank you btw, i will dig into these comments
this is just a small first step at simplifying / stripping the jargon out of their messaging
So - I just finished reading the google doc
I don’t disagree with any of the comments so far
I suppose what Im thinking about now - and this might be more trouble than it’s worth at this stage - is trying to get to what the proverbial "1/4” hole" is for TI
Feel free to tune me out - Im just going to marinate on this for a second
it may not get anywhere
So - if time is a flat circle….no wait thats something else.

I guess where Im going with this is: why are people curating content? I think the internal use case, the Deloitte use case, is a little more straight forward: they have a ton of available content and they need to make sure that people have access to the right stuff. The other use case - brand-based content marketing-type stuff, my question is: at a core level why are people doing content marketing?
sorry - distracted by a DSD conversation
anyway - back to my free association - which for the record Im only putting down here in case I stumble into something non-dumb
if you’re doing content marketing, are you trying to make your brand relevant by proxy to other relevant things?
is it an SEO play?
what Im trying to get towards is, and I THINK this is what Ewald was driving to: how can we get away from the physical functionality of TI
at least in our top-level messaging
like - a drill is a thing with a handle and a trigger and it takes bits and screws in and out
but in the end - it’s the level, well placed, unstripped screw we’re selling
so maybe part of TI’s top line value is “Relevance”

but that could be any of these companies - what I like about TI is that they’re not going to deliver the same <http://F.co|F.co> article everyone else is posting. Or at least not only that. Like “Uniquely relevant"
agree with everything you’re saying. how can we get to some solid messaging before you jerks go to europe?
We bring this up on today's call
as a starting point
Im working on it
ok
Im still trying to process what the core of this is
like - is there a better thing/word/concept than “relevant”?
what do people do with the 'content' when we deliver it to them?
like what are our customers customers doing with anything that trapit does?
relevance seems like a decent word - YOU become more relevant if you can deliver stuff like this
yeah - I think it’s decent
yea i think relevant works
Im just spending a moment trying to figure out if thats the bedrock
“actionable” i’m less sold on
yeah - i think, for me, it has baggage
"X product features highly relevant content marketing solutions for your fast paced marketplace"
connect is interesting
connecting to people through content
not that that makes relevance any less a good word
yeah - I want to stay away from the notion that the content is relevant
connection is far more human
my thinking is that TI makes YOU relevant
right, that makes sense
connected is interesting
you become relevant when you can connect to your audience
i also dont like the word audience… i know i used it a lot in that doc
it seemed more agnostic than “customers” or “users"
or “team"
right
we can wordsmith that
so - some other things I’m thinking about - again - totally random
this idea of signal vs. noise
and amplifying signal
right
and connecting signals
thats what they’re using right now
oh really?
"Trapit's mission is to raise the signal and lower the noise."
shit - I’ve just come full circle
well there you go
A file was shared
you know
though i’m not sure all of their users/clients are familiar with signal to noise ratios
if you cut out all the words except “raise the signal, lower the noise"
it’s non-terrible
right. i dont like the way they use the word engage, either. they just throw it at everything
shit - if you cut out all the words expect “raise the signal"
i like that
yeah - I think they have just too many words
they talk too much
yes
right now TI IS the noise
and it abstracts the 'signal'
to be whatever IT is
whatever you do is the signal
I like that
er: the content is the signal
or something
i like it though
whats iterating to be about that is that it begins to get me towards an actual 1/4” hole
i think as a general framework - we can put the mantra out there that Trapit should never be the noise
because not all conent is signal
most content is noise
that is ostensibly what TI does: it delivers to you only signal - so you deliver only signal
all of TI’s stuff is about cutting noise: you can train the CCC, it pulls from unique, human vetted sources
and thereby are more relevant to your people
right
In my notebook I have “signal. amplified."
which is a little copywriter-y - but I don’t hate the premise
I like the notion that they start with a high-signal level, and then the rest about amplification of that
i also like that in a word they can brush aside their competition
we don't need to mention noise. Everything else is the noise
the word signal doesnt mean anything by itself though
I think it does
what makes you say that?
i think if everything supported that, it wouldn't be alone
graphics/photos/whatever
just in terms of signal-noise ratio, which is what they’re referencing… it’s a ratio
and as a word by itself it seems a little vague… i think “relevant content” is more informative / on-point than the word “signal"
interesting
I actually feel the opposite.
for me - “signal” gets to the heart of purpose
like - just word itself - outside of the vs. noise connotation, it has a meaning that I like
i guess it just feels overly technical
and not very human
to me
interesting
I hand’t thought of it like that
i think of distress signals
yeah - I think this is just us coming at it from different perspectives
which isn’t bad - just interesting
yup
because for me - I think - yeah - distress signals - exactly - it’s all about communicating directly
like - “hey! rescue me!"
which, again, Im not trying to change your mind, but what doesn’t work for is why it works for me

i also think it is worth considering how TI will get people to the site. If people are already aware that they are indeed content marketers vs. needing to introduce the premise to a person - "Signal" has a particular connotation
so here is where I am
I would like to not lead with “content” as a word
shit - ANYTHING will have a particular connotation depending on how/who goes to the site
we’ll have to use it in the copy
agreed re: content
but in terms of a core headline
i think we're all on same page there
I think “relevant" is a key concept but that word isn’t doing it for me
Im not married to “signal” but I like that while it has a multitude of uses, they all go back to the same idea: ”I need you to hear this"
for me its a function, not a bug, that it can be made concrete in a number of different ways
so regardless of what we end up using, thats whats appealing to me
i’m not opposed to presenting it as an option, i just want to know where else we can go
yeah - I think thats smart
also keep in mind that the reality of this project is there's a PR firm, Trapit and us circling around this in some fashion
the doc that we saw was the output of PR + Trapit
I’m not as anti-“content” as you two
yeah - I hear you re: PR firm
mainly because i’m not sure what else to call it, and also because i really don’t think we can avoid it.
Im not sure what to do about that
no - you’re right - we can’t avoid talking about content
although you’re right that we dont need to lead with it
yeah - its just that
i’m not sure whether we should be leading with “what trapit does for you” e.g. helps you discover great content, or “what you can do with trapit” e.g. connect with your audience
so - ideally - what I’d like to do is figure out what contains both of those
thats sort of what Im circling around this morning
ok. let me know if anything sticks that I can incorporate into designs
okay cool
so here’s my plan: I need to switch back to One4All this afternoon because I’m the only person working on that - But i was going to toss a couple things in the google purely as straw men
please do!
i just want whatever comps Hank sees to at least hint toward some proposed messaging
I was just sent this document that seems fairly appropriate given our conversations today.
A file was shared
boy I wish we had budget to put something like that together for TI
rather than trying to do it while we’re also actually making the site
but still - I think thats totally on point
ugh me too
Catching up on these messages now

this is some of the stuff i was trying to get at with all of those brand exercises i was printing out, but the truth is i’ve never done something like this for a client before so i didn’t really know where to start
well - the reality is that a project like this is at the same scope as all the work we’re doing for them
I guarantee RG/A spent months on this
oh, for sure
this has always been a favorite of mine: <http://voiceandtone.com/>
That's a good one Melissa
sorry - missed this follow up conversation
agreed with all of that
i also think we should just assert some stuff for Trapit
like - no matter what, i want to them to edit ruthlessly
Im putting this here to bookmark it: I wonder if we could use TI to grab images for the site….

THEME IDEA: Human. People are what make the difference in Trapit’s content. Content by people, for people. Humanist font, hand-drawn illustrations to supplement key selling points, emphasis on photography of people.
I like that. Question for y’all: is that going to be too contrary to TI’s identity as technically advanced?
I don’t think it has to, and it might be good to reframe that idea through the lens of its impact on people
this is where i think beats positioning comes in for me — it is essentially the same. We're machine AND human.
i'm with Justin in that the basic history of Trapit, their competence, etc. is all about machine
but i think we could frame everything around the impact to people vs. people being the thing in general
OR
we expose the people behidn the machine — literally. Not the human curators, but the people who worked to build the best algorithm.
which leads in a circle back to SRI/Darpa and the like
New Theme: CYBORGS
done.
ship it.
